page.title: 13Thurnham
page.content: Cockersand Abbey was founded in ll90; only the Chapter House remains standing. This is polygonal with vaulting on the interior and carving on the red sandstone central pier. It was used as the burial place for the Dalton family. Crook Farm may have been a desmesne farm of the Abbey, one field is called Chapel Hill. Some fine windows reputed to be from the Abbey are built into the house and shippon. A beam in the Old Barn is dated R.D.l676. Clarksons Farm is dated l680. There is a salt cupboard dated R.C.A. l68l.
